Package com.welie.blessed

Class BluetoothBytesParser

java.lang.Object
com.welie.blessed.BluetoothBytesParser
public class BluetoothBytesParser
extends java.lang.Object
Parser for Bluetooth data types

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    BluetoothBytesParser()
    Create a BluetoothBytesParser that does not contain a byte array and sets the byteOrder to LITTLE_ENDIAN.
    BluetoothBytesParser​(byte[] value)
    Create a BluetoothBytesParser and set the byte array and sets the byteOrder to LITTLE_ENDIAN.
    BluetoothBytesParser​(byte[] value, int offset)
    Create a BluetoothBytesParser, set the byte array, the internal offset and the byteOrder to LITTLE_ENDIAN.
    BluetoothBytesParser​(byte[] value, int offset, java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder)
    Create a BluetoothBytesParser, set the byte array, the internal offset and the byteOrder.
    BluetoothBytesParser​(byte[] value, java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder)
    Create a BluetoothBytesParser and set the byte array and byteOrder.
    BluetoothBytesParser​(java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder)
    Create a BluetoothBytesParser that does not contain a byte array and sets the byteOrder.

      value - byte array
      byteOrder - the byte order to use (either LITTLE_ENDIAN or BIG_ENDIAN)

    • BluetoothBytesParser

      public BluetoothBytesParser​(byte[] value, int offset)
      Create a BluetoothBytesParser, set the byte array, the internal offset and the byteOrder to LITTLE_ENDIAN.
      Parameters:
      value - the byte array
      offset - the offset from which parsing will start

    • BluetoothBytesParser

      public BluetoothBytesParser​(byte[] value, int offset, java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder)
      Create a BluetoothBytesParser, set the byte array, the internal offset and the byteOrder.
      Parameters:
      value - the byte array
      offset - the offset from which parsing will start
      byteOrder - the byte order, either LITTLE_ENDIAN or BIG_ENDIAN

  • Method Details

    • getIntValue

      public java.lang.Integer getIntValue​(int formatType)
      Return an Integer value of the specified type. This operation will automatically advance the internal offset to the next position.
      Parameters:
      formatType - The format type used to interpret the byte(s) value
      Returns:
      An Integer object or null in case the byte array was not valid

    • getIntValue

      public java.lang.Integer getIntValue​(int formatType, java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder)
      Return an Integer value of the specified type and specified byte order. This operation will automatically advance the internal offset to the next position.
      Parameters:
      formatType - the format type used to interpret the byte(s) value
      byteOrder - the byte order to use
      Returns:
      an Integer object or null in case the byte array was not valid

    • getLongValue

      public long getLongValue​(int offset, java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder)
      Return a Long value using the specified byte order and offset position. This operation will not advance the internal offset to the next position.
      Parameters:
      offset - the offset to use
      byteOrder - the byte order to use
      Returns:
      an Long object or null in case the byte array was not valid

    • getIntValue

      public java.lang.Integer getIntValue​(int formatType, int offset, java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder)
      Return an Integer value of the specified type. This operation will not advance the internal offset to the next position.

      The formatType parameter determines how the byte array is to be interpreted. For example, settting formatType to FORMAT_UINT16 specifies that the first two bytes of the byte array at the given offset are interpreted to generate the return value.

      Parameters:
      formatType - The format type used to interpret the byte array.
      offset - Offset at which the integer value can be found.
      byteOrder - the byte order, either LITTLE_ENDIAN or BIG_ENDIAN
      Returns:
      Cached value of the byte array or null of offset exceeds value size.

    • getFloatValue

      public java.lang.Float getFloatValue​(int formatType)
      Return a float value of the specified format. This operation will automatically advance the internal offset to the next position.
      Parameters:
      formatType - The format type used to interpret the byte array
      Returns:
      The float value at the position of the internal offset

    • getFloatValue

      public java.lang.Float getFloatValue​(int formatType, java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder)
      Return a float value of the specified format and byte order. This operation will automatically advance the internal offset to the next position.
      Parameters:
      formatType - The format type used to interpret the byte array
      byteOrder - the byte order, either LITTLE_ENDIAN or BIG_ENDIAN
      Returns:
      The float value at the position of the internal offset

    • getFloatValue

      public java.lang.Float getFloatValue​(int formatType, int offset, java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder)
      Return a float value of the specified format, offset and byte order. This operation will not advance the internal offset to the next position.
      Parameters:
      formatType - The format type used to interpret the byte array
      offset - the offset to use
      byteOrder - the byte order, either LITTLE_ENDIAN or BIG_ENDIAN
      Returns:
      The float value at the position of the internal offset

      public java.util.Date getDateTime()
      Return a the date represented by the byte array.

      The byte array must conform to the DateTime specification (year, month, day, hour, min, sec)

      Returns:
      the Date represented by the byte array
